titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Anarchism Serials TAM.766
titlestmt.author: Megan O'Shea, Molly A. Cross, and Alexa Logush
titlestmt.sponsor: The arrangement, description, and encoding of this collection has been made possible in part by a major grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities: Exploring the human endeavor.

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-01-21 16:05:58 -0500.

change.item: Updated by Molly A. Cross to incorporate material omitted during initial processing of the collection
Updated by Jennipher Ambrose to incorporate material omitted during initial processing of the collection

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.unittitle: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Anarchism Serials

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

physdesc.extent: in 24 manuscript boxes, 1 half manuscript box, and 33 flat boxes

did.abstract: The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Anarchism Serials contains over 300 titles on anarchist movements and philosophies in the United States, Italy, Spain, France, and other countries. The collection dates between 1890 and 2010, with the bulk of the material dating from the 1960s through 1990s. Topics include anarchist theories and principles regarding economic, political, social, and labor issues in the United States and other countries; anarcho-syndicalist movements in Europe in the 20th century; and feminist movements within anarchist organizations.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
did.langmaterial: Materials primarily in English, with some publications in French, Spanish, Italian, Czech, German, Portuguese, Norwegian, Dutch, and Greek.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Serials in this collection are arranged alphabetically by title.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Because of the assembled nature of this collection, copyright status varies across the collection. Copyright is assumed to be held by the original creator of individual items in the collection; these items are expected to pass into the public domain 120 years after their creation. Repository is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This collection combines serials relating to anarchism drawn from two discrete groups of material held by the Tamiment Library. The first was a partially inventoried backlog of serials, received by the library through donations, subscriptions, and in archival collections. The second group consisted of around 1,700 serials, newspapers, and magazines, organized by title as an artificial collection, referred to as Periodicals.001 or Boxed Newspapers. This material was combined, inventoried, and arranged and described in subject-based categories in 2017. The accession number related to this collection is 2017.049.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Anarchism Serials; TAM 766; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library & Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The material in this collection was assembled from various backlogs of uncataloged material held by the Tamiment Library. This material was inventoried, separated according to its subject matter, and arranged in a series of subject-based artificial collections. Accumulations of material relating to anarchism were identified and brought together physically. Materials were housed in archival folders and boxes according to size. The inventory is arranged alphabetically by title of publication, with publishing organization and place of publication listed when known.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Due to the fragile nature of certain original materials, researchers may be required to consult microfilm copies, preservation photocopies, or digital images of material in this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Anarchism Serials contains over 300 titles on anarchist movements and philosophies in the United States (US), Italy, Spain, France, and other countries. The collection dates between 1890 and 2010, with the bulk of the material dating from the 1960s through 1990s. Topics include anarchist theories and principles regarding economic, political, social, and labor issues in Europe, the US, and other countries; anarcho-syndicalist movements in Europe in the 20th century; and feminist movements within anarchist organizations. Large runs of titles include Umanit√† Nova, Freedom: Anarchist Weekly, Direkte Aktion, Orto: Revista Cultural de Ideas Acratas, and A Rivista Anarchica. The collection includes serials published in the US, Europe, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, Africa, and Asia, with the majority of the titles published in France, Italy, Spain, and the United Kingdom (UK). Anarchist organizations represented in the collection include national federations such as the Italian Anarchist Federation (Federazione Anarchica Italiana) and Germany's Free Workers' Union (Freie Arbeiterinnen- und Arbeiter-Union), publishing houses such as London's Freedom Press, and state and local-level groups.
